"Now is not the time nor the place to be trying new, dangerous spells" you think to yourself. You decide that your best bet is fear. You conjure up a simple flame, hoping that this will intimidate the guards into fleeing. "Leave now and I wont hurt you" you yell in the most demanding, fearless voice you can muster up, but your fear is evident.

The guards just stand there starring at you for a moment, then all of a sudden the guard with the green eyes starts cracking up. "Oh man that is rich, now seriously kid surrender before you get yourself hurt" the green eyed guard response in between laughs. You conjure a flame in your second hand and get in your battle stance ready to fight.

With a wave of her arm a ring of fire surrounds the three of you, trapping you. "Crap battle mages!" The realization is a terrifying one. These are by far the most feared soldiers in the kingdom. If having magical, almost impenetrable armor against both magic and physical attacks was not enough, they are well studied in the magical arts, making them nearly unstoppable.

You quickly realize that your only hope is to flee. You quickly turn around to try and make a path through the wall of fire, but before you can even get a spell off, you feel something hit your back, stunning your body and dropping you to the ground. Not being able to catch yourself, your head hits hard against the ground and you momentarily black out.

As you slowly awaken, you are lying on your back, still unable to move. As your vision clears you are startled to see one of the knight kneeling over your head. "Well its about time you woke up sleepy head" she giggles. The comforting tone of the blue eyed knight's voice puts you on edge. The green eyed knight walks into your view and stares at you for a moment, before asking "What do you think we should do with him?" The tone in her voice is less comforting than the blue eyed knight, sounding a lot more professional.
132131.title: The guards stun you with their shields and have...

choices: You head down to the courtyard and meet with the other inmates
1321311.content:
The blue-eyed guard laughs heartily. Her feminine giggles are at odds with her heavily armored appearance. "I think I know a nice punishment, for starters", she says. She pulls off an enchanted metal glove and snakes a finger into your belly button. "Hah, stop, stop!" you beg to her. She responds with a negative shake of her helmet. "I think I found his weakness..." the spellsword coos, and her tone drives you to act. A large firey ball appears in one of your hands, bigger than anything you have ever conjured before, perhaps because of your anger at being tickled like a child.

It's in vain, though, as she swats your flame out like a bug with a more powerful spell, and pins your arms above your head. Behind you the green-eyed knight casts a spell: suddenly your legs are bound together. You upper body is immobilized too when the blue eyed knight sits on your waist. "Naughty, naughty little mage." she whispers, and then she plunges her fingers into your sides. You howl and squirm in laughter, but the weight of all the armor on top of you prevents all but wriggles. You shriek louder when the green-eyed soldier conjures tickly brush-gauntlets, and runs their bristles between you toes and all over your soles. But there is no sentient being in the forest to hear your struggles.

Your vision blurs when Blue Eyes sticks five fingers into each armpit. You laugh louder as Green Eyes rubs her bristly palm across the heel and arch of your foot. You pass out, and the last thing you remember is being hoisted over one of their shoulders.

---

"Wake up, prisoner!" a prison guard shouts into your face through the firm bars of the jail cell. "You're in here for five long years, for stealing a dangerous magical artifact.", she tells you. "Any attempt at magic will be met with a very tickly punishment." With that statement she leaves you. You look at your cell: it is a tiny, dingy hole, with a dirty cot and a bucket for your business in the corner. Your cell lies next to rows of other ones, about four stories of cells overlook a dusty prison courtyard,and you can see male and female figures alike sitting and walking in it. Guards in armor stand at about every six or seven cells, looking vigilant for the most part.
1321311.title: Why tickle him of course!

13213112.content:
"Guard, I would like to head down to the courtyard" a nearby prisoner yells to the guard near his cell. One of the guards approaches the cell, opens it up, and escorts the man down the staircase. Moments later the guard returns to her post. Realizing you are not going to get anywhere in here, you turn towards the guard. "I would also like to go to the courtyard".

You hear the guard groan, clearly annoyed that she has to escort yet another prisoner outside, but begrudgingly opens your cell. "Follow me prisoner, and since you are new I will warn you, any funny business and you will be taken to the corrections facility. And trust me you never want to end up in there". The tone in her voice is serious and sends shivers down your spine. You don't know what goes on in the corrections facility, but you are certain you never want to end up there.

She escorts you down the cement staircases and you head down through a tunnel, guarded by two guards. A magical barrier, giving off a purple light, blocks the way to the courtyard. One of the guards steps up and removes the barrier, clearing the path outside. You and the guard walk through and when you look back you are shocked to see that the barrier is already back.

The guard leaves you and passes back through the barrier, leaving you by yourself. Looking around, you see that the prison is surrounded by large stone walls. Guard towers are positioned every 30 feet along the tops of the wall. Looking around you can sense the lack of hope in the prisoners spirits. Although a few of the prisoners are talking in small groups, most of them are sitting around, keeping to themselves.

You see one prisoner who is standing near the wall, looking up at the sky with a depressed look on his face. You approach the man. "Thinking of breaking out" you ask the man as he studies the top of the wall. "Na, there is not escape from this place, the guards monitor your every move. And being caught means being sent to the corrections facility" the man says, never looking down from the top of the wall.

"What exactly happens in the corrections facility" you ask the man curious. The man sighs for a moment, turns towards you, and slowly shakes his head. "Trust me, you are better off not knowing. The only thing you need to know is that you never, ever want to be sent there. So what are you in for?" the man asks. You tell him the story about how you were sent here for stealing a book, which in your opinion seems pretty unfair.

"The length of your stay does not matter, nobody leaves the prison. The guards look for any excuse to keep you hear longer. There are rumors of prisoners who got added ten years for walking too fast or breathing too loud. Some prisoners claim they were just swept up off the streets and ended up here, without committing a single crime" The man warns "If there is one thing I know, this prison is not sanctioned by the king. These guards make there own rules"

You start to realize you are in a lot of trouble. You have to escape......
13213112.title: You head down to the courtyard and meet with th...

choices: Walk to Katira and challenge her.
132131121.content:
"So that's it?" you ask the prisoner, "Just sit here and rot for here for a decade?" The man replies, "Who knows how long you'll be here? Some prisoners have been here for forty years, some are released the next year they arrived. It's not completely random; more dangerous prisoners get released far later than a pickpocket. But don't expect to get released anytime soon. The guards lengthen sentences all the time."

This is bad news. Ten or more years in prison will spell the end to your spell-casting career. You've got to get out, but how?

Your gaze is drawn to a prison brawl in the dust fifteen meters or so to your left. Ten or twenty prisoners surround it, so you move in for a closer look. Two prisoners fight ferociously on the ground. One is a blonde-haired man about your size and age, but a bit taller. The other is a woman with a shaved head but a pretty face. She is shorter than you but more muscular, not surprising since being a mage requires little heavy lifting. The man who had been speaking to you earlier taps you on the shoulder. "That's Katira. She's well-informed about many things in this place. A seasoned prisoner, too; they shaved her head because she kept hiding tools in her hair. If you want to go through with your delusions of escape, she's the one to ask. But one thing: a newcomer like you wants to talk with a seasoned prisoner like her, you're gonna have to past a test."

"What kind of test?" you ask him. "Combat and wrestling." he replies. "You're gonna need to beat or draw her in a match. That's what that kid over there is trying to do." "That kid" isn't doing too well by now. You see that that woman Katira has his arms pinned above his head while she's sitting on his chest. The motley crowd cheers her on. Suddenly she digs her nails deep into the armpits of her opponent. The effect is immediate: he bucks and shakes in an attempt to get her to stop, but she hangs on, cat-like. After a minute or two he is too tired to struggle, and lies quivering and laughing while her deft hands squeeze his sides. After some time she lets him go, and he crawls away wheezing and gasping.

This all came as a surprise to you, it seems like everyone on the land of Avara uses tickling alongside or as regular weaponry. And quite an effective weapon it is, against your ticklish body. But you have one advantage against Katira: magic. If you use magic without the guard noticing you could pull off a draw, or maybe even a win. If you do this you'll be one step closer to escaping the prison.
132131121.title: The Challenge

choices: Engage Katira in a fight (can cheat or not)
Go to steal the mirror for her
1321311211.content:
The crowd is dispersing and Katira starts to walk away. Before she has time to leave the scene, you walk to her and put your hand on her shoulder. She whirls around instantly and stares at you with a piercing glare. "Hey, I heard you know things around here" you get out, "Do you know of any weaknesses in the prison security?" She squints at you with her gray eyes for a few seconds before answering. "Maybe. But I don't give out information for free. If anybody else sees me doing favors, especially to a shrimp like you, they're gonna know something's up and I'll be a target. Anyway, even if there are a few weaknesses I doubt a clumsy oaf like you could get five feet into the guard rooms and towers surrounding this place, much less even the first wall." With that she shakes her head and turns to go back to her cell.

Her callous remarks anger you, and fueled with the thoughts of getting out and becoming a master wizard you grasp her leather tunic by the collar as her back is turned. Quick as a viper she whirls and jabs you in the side with one finger. A burst of ticklishness hits you and knocks you back. Stifling your giggles, you almost conjure a spark in your hand before remembering the magic-hating guards. Katira doesn't notice your magic, but she says to you, "I admire your spirit. If you want your information you must beat me in a fighting match. Many have tried before, few have won." She thinks for a moment. "There is another way...

"See that balcony high up there?" she points several stories above the yard to an imposing balcony. "It's the private quarters of the captain of the guards."

"In the private rooms of the captain of the guards there is a mirror: a gift from some official who saw how well-guarded this place was." Katira tells you. "I don't care about my reflection; it contains glass from the Sands of Mystery: said to be weightless and invisible to the human and elven eye. The glass would make the perfect shiv and the other prisoners would fear my power, so I could become a powerful gang leader. I'll tell you everything about how to escape if you get me that mirror. Or you can fight me..."
1321311211.title: Walk to Katira and challenge her.

1322.content:
You decide against stealing the book, knowing that a shop filled with magical items is also probably filled with magical traps.

As you walk out on to the street you try and think of a way to make money. You could put on a street performance with some of your illusions. You also heard from Thorne that there is an arena near by. Surely none of the fighters there would be any match for your magic. You also heard from Emily that there are ancient ruins near by filled with untold treasures.

After carefully weighing your options you decide to go with the...
1322.title: Leave the shop empty handed

choices: He wants you to investigate the old coffin he recently found in his basement.
He wants you to deliver a sealed book to the High Priestess
He wants you to stop a small pirate force that has been stealing book shipments.
1323.content:
No. You're a mage, not a thief! Refusing to sacrifice your honor for a few charms, you set the book back down on its dusty stand. Besides, who knows what could happen if you're caught stealing? You head back a few sections to the learner's section and find another book. It's called: "Spark to Thunderbolt: Mastering Basic Spells" by Serena Froststone. This sounds interesting, since you've already learned the (very) basics from papers in your older brother's room. Mr. Dragonbot, snoozing by the fire, certainly won't mind if you take a look inside...

The book seems to be very educational indeed. It seems to be about turning simple magic gimmicks into more useful stuff. From what you see this includes turning the simple ball of mage-light into a wisp that ticklishly assaults foes, refining levitation into complex telekinesis, and more. "I need this book!" you think to yourself.

You approach Mr. Dragonbot and wake him. It's only when he asks you for a dozen gold coins payment when you remember that you're dirt poor. Lucky old Dragonbot is a kindly soul. "Tell you what, son" he says to you, "You remind me of myself in my younger years. If you do me a small favor, you can have the book for free." This sounds like a good deal to you! "What's the favor?" you ask.

He tells you.
1323.title: Continue Browsing

choices: She drags you through the coffin to her castle.
13231.content:
Ok, sounds easy enough. How bad can one guy's cellar be? The coffin probably just holds the bones of his dead granny or something, anyway. "I accept!" you reply "Let's go to the basement." Mr. Dragonbot leads you to a broom closet, but when he opens the door you can see that an old stone block covers a hole in the floor. You try to lift it up, but it's too heavy for your boyish arms. "Step aside, son." Dragonbot tells you. He murmers an incantation and the block turns transparent. It must have been an intangibility spell. "After you, if you please." says the shopkeeper. You climb down a short ladder into a room below.

As you reach the stone floor, Mr. Dragonbot suddenly turns the stone solid again, trapping you inside! No amount of begging and banging will open it. You're stuck down here, so you might as well look around. The hall is quite large, with rows of upright and collapsed bookshelves holding molded old books, none of which seem complete enough to read. At the end of the hall, on a stone dais, is a large black wooden coffin, with a skull etched in the front. This must be what that old trickster wanted you to look into. With nowhere else to go but forward, you walk to the coffin.

As you approach a dull violet light hums from the coffin. Cautious of this, you carefully take a few more steps forward. When you step onto the stone podium the lid of the coffin flashes brightly and disintegrates, and a figure stumbles out, hunched over. It's dressed in a maroon corset with shoulder ruffles, a shadowy black gown, and a red-studded choker. The distractingly low top reveals that the figure is obviously a woman. You are striken, and back up a bit, causing your leather shoes to clap against the stone. Her head shoots up, revealing bright orange eyes and blood-red lips set in a pale complexion. She hisses and moves incredibly quickly, grabbing you by the collar of your tunic and lifting you up against a rotting shelf. The woman smiles seductively, showing two pointed teeth for canines. She's a vampire! She whispers to you, "Thank you for freeing me from my realm, young mortal. Soon Avara shall fear my name again: Charnelle the Ancient!"

Your eyes widen, for legends tell of the wicked vampiress Charnelle, and her ways of tormenting innocents. "Now what shall I do with you, meat?" she asks seductively. Her lips on your ear tickle, and you fidget in her unnaturally strong grasp. An unholy grin forms on her face when she sees this. "Ticklish, fresh blood? It's been a while since I had a victim to tickle in my castle..." Her grip immobilizes you while she tickles you to tears with her dark red nails, which poke and squeeze your sides.

Thoughts race through your tickle-addled brain, and you come up with an idea. With one hand you summon a glowing fireball, which you recently learned from that book you found in the store. You raise up the molten ball near Charnelle's face, and she shrieks and backs away before it touches her. You need to act quickly!
13231.title: He wants you to investigate the old coffin he r...

choices: Become a course for tonight's "tickle banquet"
Kat brings you down to the dungeon to play with you and the other servants
132312.content:
The vampire snarls, again showing pointy white fangs, and two tentacles of shadow appear from behind her. You turn and run from this sorcery, but before you can make it five steps an impossibly long tentacle conjuration trips you up and you fall hard on your chest. Before you even have a chance to attempt to get up both magical limbs drill into your ribs, squeezing out deep chortles and screams as their rough tickling never ceases. As her two conjurations keep you in hysterics, Charnelle approaches you looking annoyed but a little impressed.

"It's not so often that fresh prey puts up a good fight like you. I'm almost considering letting you go. What say you?" You can only manage a pitiful "PLEASEPLEASEHAHAHAHA!" on the stone floor as her two back-tentacles burrow into ticklish ribs and sides. "I'm not hearing a yes, little boy." she says. "I suppose I'll have to bring you home then..."

She walks up to you, and while her magical tentacles tickle your upper body she grabs a foot with a surprisingly strong grip. Already laughing from the apparations, you screech in hysterics when you feel her long nails gently wiggling up and down your tender foot. It's too much and you soon pass out. The last thing you remember is her bending down to your neck, fangs bared.

You wake up, immobile in what seems like a large banquet hall. Well, not immobile your hand are bound though. You get up from the floor to find that your legs are in chains, albeit not ones that stop you from walking. A man and a woman, both vampires, also have their hands gripped to your arms to prevent you from running. You stand in front of a throne, a grand stone chair where Charnelle sits musing to herself about you. Finally she speaks, more to herself than you.

"I'm having a dinner tonight, a banquet of... indulgence. I'm sure my guests would enjoy your ticklish flesh at their mercy. But I'm sure my caretaker, Katerina, would also like to have some time alone with a new servant like you." She points to the woman who holds one of your arms, her long black hair seperated by a purple streak. You attempt to speak up but she silences you with a poke to the armpit.

"Choices, choices, choices."
132312.title: She drags you through the coffin to her castle.

15.content:
You stare over board and watch the waves crash against the side of the ship. You and five others are sailing into the port of Avara in hopes of finding some gold. Avara is a prosperous town with many opportunities for new citizens. This places is not all good though, they have a major crime problem and many of the guards are corrupt. You see your destination growing larger in the horizon until you guys reach port.

The port guard stops you as you walk off of the ship.

"What is your business in Avara" the large man asks you
"We were looking for some opportunities to earn some coin" You tell him
"Well we are a prosperous town with many job opportunities so your task should not be to difficult. I will need names"
"I am Blair, And this is Emily, Arthur, Thorne, and Knight"
"Ah perfect, welcome to Avara"

The guard lets you pass and you enter the town square and turn to your companions. Arthur tells you he is heading to the library and leaves all of you. Knight and Thorne are heading to the town guard to see if they need any mercenary work done and they too leave you. Emily says that she is going to steal stuff and leaves you alone in the town square.

You figure that the town pub will be the best place to look for work. You are about to head to the shop when you notice a large ruby sitting on one of the local shop stands. This is usually Emily department but how hard could it be? You also see a help wanted sign for the local black smith.
15.title: Blair

choices: Wake up in the same room as Nova
151.content:
You stare at the ruby and try and decide what you want to do. Your conscience gets the best of you and you decide to pass on the ruby. You then head across the street to the blacksmith. "Sorry sweetheart, I don't think you have the strength to be a blacksmith" you hear from the blacksmith when you tell him you want the job. That just leaves the "Drunken Fiddler" the local tavern.

It is still fairly early in the morning so when you enter the tavern, you are not surprised that it is almost deserted. The only occupants of the bar are the friendly looking bartender, the barmaid cleaning a table, and a shady looking woman sitting in the corner of the bar drinking a beer. You approach the bar tender.

"Would you like anything to drink?" he asks you
"Yea would love one" you say handing him a gold coin. He throws you a beer.
"New in town eh? What brings you to Avara?"
"Well I used to be part of a town called Bowerstone. We were in a war with the a nearby village and I was part of a elite squad assigned with protecting the king and queen. We were good at our job however the war ended and we were no longer needed. We decided to head west in search of a new life"

"Wow exciting life" you hear someone say behind you. You turn around and the woman who was sitting in the corner of the room is now standing behind you. Mind if I take a seat?"
"Not at all"
"If you are looking for a bit of coin, I hear the woods of Blashire has riches you would not believe in them. I was planning on heading out there tomorrow and could use some help." she says
"Sounds tempting, I'll have to think it over though"
"You don't have to decide right now, just let me know what you decide by morning"

You tell her you will and the two of you chat for and drink for the remainder of the night. You learn that her name is Nova. She, like you, used to be in the town guard until her town was ransacked by bandits. Since then she has been doing anything to make ends meet. The more you drink, the less professional your conversation ends. The last thing you remember is dancing on the bar table, then you black out.

You awaken in the morning and you......
151.title: Head to the pub

1512.content:
"What happened last night" you think to yourself as you slowly wake up. You slowly open your eyes and realize you are laying in a bed. You are in one of the rooms in the Inn. You don't recall how you got here or a lot of the events that accrued last night. All you know is you had a little to much to drink and based off of the sun coming through your window, day has arrived.

You decide you should get out of bed and start your day. You go to get up when something is wrong. You are tied spread eagle in your bed, in just your bra and panties. Looking around you are startled when you see a woman standing in front of you. She has a wicked grin on her face that gives you Goosebumps.

"Why hello sleepy head" the woman says giggling. It is....
1512.title: Are tied to a bed

15121.content:
Nova! You should have known! She was the one who got you drunk in the first place! You try to pull on your ropes, but you found out she has done a good job in tying you to the bed. You notice notice, giving you a sly grin, standing in the front of the bed, wearing tight leather pants, and a leather armor, that covers her chest, but leaves her belly bare.

Nova: well, it look like someone finally woke up.
You: nova! Why did you do this! Untie me at once!
Nova: you see, about that treasure at blashire forest i told you about, i REALLY need that treasure in order to pay off my debts, and i'll feel a little bit safer knowing that a strong archer is with me...

As she says this, she trails a fingernail down from your hand, across your outstretched arms, towards your underarms. You know you are deathly ticklish on almost every inch of your skin, and you already are trying to hold back light giggles. Your mouth slowly turns into a wide smile. Nova then notices this, and asks you about it.

Nova: whats so funny? Your trapped here, where only i can release you, and you have no hope of escape!

As she says this, she places her hand on your belly. This surprises you, as you let out a gasp of surprise, and abruptly suck in your belly. She then finally understands what is making you smile, as she gives you another sly grin.

Nova: well well, my... ticklish archer, it seems that someones a little bit on the... sensitive, side of life. Looks like she can shoot an apple on the top of someones head, but cant protect herself against a few wiggling fingers.

She waves all of her fingers menacingly in front of your face, making you gulp in fear.

Nova: well, now i think i know how to convince you to join me in order to search for this treasure! Now let's see, where shall we begin...
15121.title: Nova

151212.content: Nova lifts her hand from your stomach. You sigh in relief, your stomach is hyper-ticklish. Then, however, she begins to stroke her finger down your right arm, toward your underarm. "Looks like someone has ticklish underarms." Nova teases, sliding her finger up and down your arm, teasing you. "Stop it, let me go!" You demand, trying to keep the smile off your face. You can't, however, when Nova's finger finally reaches your armpit, scratching gently. You giggle and squirm, try to crane your head to see the tickling. "Stop tickling me!" You gasp between giggles. "Now, now, my tickle toy, you know I can't do that." Nova responds, still teasing your underarm. You tug at the ropes holding you, but it's a pointless struggle. Nova begins tickling you with her entire hand, spider tickling your sensitive flesh. Your giggles evolve into laughs as you pull at your restraints, desperate to stop your armpit from being tickled. Nova smiles, a little more crazy then genuine. Her other hand goes to your other arm, slowly stroking it's way down toward the underarm. You laugh louder, unable to stop Nova from tickling you. Both her hands are now wiggling in your armpits, sending you into hysterics. Your laughing too hard now to even beg. Nova tickles you like this for six minutes, occasionally running her fingers to the top of your ribcage, sending a new but just as torturous sensation through your body. By the time she's done, your gasping for breath and red faced. Nova's just getting started, however, as she...
151212.title: Underarms

info.brief_description: follow the adventures and "ticklish perils of 5 brave heroes in the land of Avara
info.description:
Welcome to the world of Avara!

set in a world of a medieval fantasy, you take the role of one of a group of five adventurers, who are trying to possibly trying to stake out fame and fortune in this world. while the choices are entirely yours to make, there are still dangers to the five heroes. there are things out there that may pose a threat to someone as ticklish as our heroes, and many beings that would best due avoid our heroes for the same reason.

General rules
keep it second person (you)
keep the story focused on tickling. add in battles, exploration and romance (the last one is possibly optional) but make sure they all lead up to a tickling scenario.

Don't be afraid to add a chapter.

With that out of the way, enjoy.
